title: pH of pure water at 40 degree Celsius given Kw

content.question: The value of <math alttext="K sub w " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="40 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="3.0 times 10 to the negative 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of pure water at <math alttext="40 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
